DESCRIPTION: The basal flow rate, F(basal) is prescribed by a physician and entered the in to PCA pump by scanning the presceription from the drug container label as it is loaded in to the reservoir.
AUTHOR: John

DESCRIPTION: The pump shall be able to deliver basal infusion at flows throughout the basal infusion flow range of Fbasal min = 1 to Fbasal max = 10 ml/hr.
AUTHOR: John

DESCRIPTION: The PCA pump shall measure drug , F(basal) flow within a tolerance of Fmdf tol = 0.1 ml/hr.
AUTHOR: John

DESCRIPTION: If alarms are inactivated or paused through the ICE supervisor user interface, they shall be reactivated upon loss of connection to ICE
AUTHOR: John

DESCRIPTION: The control panel must display currently-programmed patient data and physician’s prescription.
AUTHOR: Caleb

DESCRIPTION: Prescriptions that violate the soft limits of the drug in the drug library shall issue a visible and audible warning requiring a soft limit confirmation by the clinician.
AUTHOR: Caleb

DESCRIPTION: The PCA pump shall maintain an electronic event log to record each action taken by the pump and each event sensed of its environment.
AUTHOR: Caleb

DESCRIPTION: A real-time clock must produce timestamps accurate to 10 ms.
AUTHOR: Caleb

DESCRIPTION: The ICE Interface shall transmit encrypted and authenticated current operating status to the ICE system.
AUTHOR: Alex

DESCRIPTION: The PCA pump shall resume prescribed infusion upon receiving an authenticated command through its ICE interface.
AUTHOR: Alex

DESCRIPTION: The drug reservoir holds liquid pain-killer supplied by the hospital pharmacy and loaded in to the PCA pump by the clinician.
AUTHOR: Alex

DESCRIPTION: If the drug volume in the reservoir measures less than Vlra = 1 ml, and an infusion is in progress, allow-reservoir warning100 shall be issued.
AUTHOR: Alex

DESCRIPTION: The drug library102 can be thought of as a lookup table that, given a drug name and a location, provides typical and safe limits of different infusion parameters. The drug library shall be determined by an authorized and authenticated hospital pharmacist
AUTHOR: John

DESCRIPTION: If a drug library’s soft limit is violated by the proposed settings, but not a hard limit, a warning is shown to the clinician by the user interface and a distinctive, irritating sound made and recorded in the Event Log.
AUTHOR: John

DESCRIPTION: The PCA pump shall implement a safety architecture112 that separates normal operation from fault detection and response.
AUTHOR: John

DESCRIPTION: When the stop button is pressed, the current pump stroke shall be completed prior to stopping the  pump.
AUTHOR: John

DESCRIPTION: A open door alarm shall be triggered when the reservoir door is opened while the pump is not stopped.
AUTHOR: Caleb

DESCRIPTION: The PCA pump shall continue to infuse for 10 minutes during interruption of mains electricity supply using battery backup, either continuously or spread over an hour. (Five minutes to recharge per minute using battery.)
AUTHOR: Caleb

DESCRIPTION: Component failure must not harm patient (beyond stopping function).
AUTHOR: Caleb

DESCRIPTION: The PCA pump must be electromagnetically compatible according to IEC 60601-1-2 (2001)
AUTHOR: Caleb

DESCRIPTION: The PCA pump shall perform a power-on-self-test (POST) to assure system integrity after being turned on, yet before any infusion begins. Failure of POST shall raise a POST alarm, stop pump
AUTHOR: Alex

DESCRIPTION: Hardware faults detected, but not masked, shall raise a fault alarm, stop pump, record it in the Fault Log, and display the reason for fault on the user interface.
AUTHOR: Alex

DESCRIPTION: Hardware faults that prevent operation of the Control Panel shall illuminate a hardware fault indicator  (light-emitting diode).
AUTHOR: Alex

DESCRIPTION: Because the drugs used for analgesia are often narcotic, requiring Drug Enforcement Agency (DEA)tracking if used in the United States, the drug reservoir and means to change prescriptions
AUTHOR: Alex

DESCRIPTION: Drug container must have a valid prescription, filled by an authorized pharmacist, for the particular patient to be infused by the PCA pump.
AUTHOR: John

DESCRIPTION: Provisioning shall be a single, unitary block-transfer.
AUTHOR: John
